name: hello
trans: n. 表示问候， 惊奇或唤起注意时的用语

sentences.english: Hello, John! How are you?
Stanley, come and say hello to your nephew.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦利，过来和你的侄子打声招呼。

sentences.english: Well, hello there ! I haven’t seen you for ages.

detailed_translations.english: used as a greeting when you see or meet someone

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示问候， 惊奇或唤起注意时的用语

name: hi
trans: int. 嗨！（表示问候或用以唤起注意）

sentences.english: Hi! How are you?
Hi there! I haven’t seen you for ages.

detailed_translations.chinese: 嗨！（表示问候或用以唤起注意）
detailed_translations.english: hello

name: hello
trans: n. 表示问候， 惊奇或唤起注意时的用语

sentences.english: Hello, John! How are you?
Stanley, come and say hello to your nephew.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦利，过来和你的侄子打声招呼。

sentences.english: Well, hello there ! I haven’t seen you for ages.

detailed_translations.english: used as a greeting when you see or meet someone

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示问候， 惊奇或唤起注意时的用语

sentences.english: The boys wanted to play football.
boys and girls aged 11–18
What a polite little boy (=  young male child  ) you are.
sentences.chinese: 你真是个有礼貌的小男孩。

sentences.english: Come on, Timmy, act like a big boy (=  an older boy  ) now.
sentences.chinese: 行了，蒂米，要有大男孩的样子了。

sentences.english: Good boy!

detailed_translations.english: a male child, or a male person in general

name: girl
trans: n. 女孩；姑娘，未婚女子；女职员，女演员；（男人的）女朋友

sentences.english: Both boys and girls can apply to join the choir.
sentences.chinese: 男孩和女孩均可申请加入合唱团。

sentences.english: Girls! Please be quiet.
a teenage girl
They have two girls and a boy.
sentences.chinese: 他们有两个女孩和一个男孩。

detailed_translations.english: a female child

sentences.english: a primary school teacher

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to teach, especially in a school

name: school
trans: n. 学校；学院；学派；鱼群

sentences.english: His mother always used to pick him up from school.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲以前一直去学校接他。

detailed_translations.english: a place where children are taught
to train or teach someone to have a certain skill, type of behaviour, or way of thinking

name: book
trans: n. 书籍；卷；帐簿；名册；工作簿

sentences.english: I’ve just started reading a book by Graham Greene.
sentences.chinese: 我刚开始看格雷厄姆·格林写的一本书。

sentences.english: a cookery book
Have you booked a holiday this year?
sentences.chinese: 你今年有没有预订去度假？

detailed_translations.english: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them
to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

name: chair
trans: n. 椅子；讲座；（会议的）主席位；大学教授的职位
vt. 担任（会议的）主席；使…入座；使就任要职

sentences.english: a kitchen chair
They bought a new table and chairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们买了一套新的桌椅。

sentences.english: One of the chair legs was broken.
Address your questions to the chair, please.
sentences.chinese: 请向主席提出你的问题。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, which has a back, a seat, and four legs

name: desk
trans: n. 办公桌；服务台；编辑部；（美）讲道台；乐谱架
adj. 书桌的；桌上用的；伏案做的

sentences.english: Marie was sitting at her desk.

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture like a table, usually with drawers in it, that you sit at to write and work

sentences.english: They had one daughter.
one hundred and twenty-one pounds
Come back at one (= one o’clock ).
Katie’s almost one (= one year old ).
The children seemed upset. One was crying.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子好像不开心，有一个在哭。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1
used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things

sentences.english: I’d like you to line up in twos, please.
sentences.chinese: 请你们两个一组排好队。

detailed_translations.english: in groups of two people or things
the number 2

sentences.english: They’ve won their last three games.
sentences.chinese: 他们赢了最近三场比赛。

sentences.english: We’d better go. It’s almost three (= three o’clock ) .
My little sister’s only three (= three years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 3
the number 3

sentences.english: She is married with four children.
They arrived just after four (= four o’clock ) .
sentences.chinese: 刚过四点钟，他们就到了。

sentences.english: Luke will soon be four (= four years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 4

name: five
trans: n. 五，五个；五美元钞票

sentences.english: There is also a golf course five miles away.
sentences.chinese: 五英里外还有个高尔夫球场。

sentences.english: I’ll be back by five (= five o’clock ) .
The family moved to Canada when he was five (= five years old ) .
sentences.chinese: 他五岁时全家移居加拿大。

detailed_translations.english: the number 5

name: pencil
trans: vt. 用铅笔写；用眉笔涂

sentences.english: a sharp pencil
a blue pencil
a pencil sketch

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that you use for writing or drawing, consisting of a wooden stick with a thin piece of a black or coloured substance in the middle
to write something or make a mark with a pencil

sentences.english: a ballpoint pen
a felt-tip pen
a pen and ink drawing

detailed_translations.english: an instrument for writing or drawing with ink

name: ruler
trans: n. 尺；统治者；[测] 划线板，划线的人

sentences.english: a 12-inch ruler

detailed_translations.chinese: 尺；统治者；[测] 划线板，划线的人
detailed_translations.english: someone such as a king or queen who has official power over a country or area

name: crayon
trans: vt. 以蜡笔作画，用颜色粉笔画

sentences.english: He coloured the picture with crayon.
They send letters — one time in crayon — detailing their rights and how I am violating some maritime treaty from the 1700s.
sentences.chinese: 他们寄信，有一次甚至是蜡笔写的，详细的描述了他们的权利和我如何违反了某些1700年代的海上条约。

detailed_translations.english: a stick of coloured  wax  or  chalk  that children use to draw pictures

detailed_translations.chinese: 以蜡笔作画，用颜色粉笔画
detailed_translations.english: to draw something with a crayon

name: pencil box
trans: 铅笔盒；文具盒；你的铅笔盒

sentences.english: Put the pen and pencil in the pencil box.
sentences.chinese: 把钢笔和铅笔放在文具盒里。

sentences.english: In 1900, a father gave a pencil box for Christmas, and the child was all smiles.
sentences.chinese: 1900年，父亲给孩子一个铅笔盒当做圣诞礼物，孩子们欢天喜地。

sentences.english: Look, there is a pencil box and a pile of notebooks. There are still many books in it, Chinese book, maths book and English book.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，里面有铅笔盒，笔记本，还有好多好多的书，语文、数学、英语。

sentences.english: six months ago
She arrived just after six (= six o’clock ) .
He learnt to play the violin when he was six (= six years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 6
the number 6

sentences.english: The women visited cities in seven states.
sentences.chinese: 这些女性访问了七个州的城市。

sentences.english: We close the store at seven (= seven o’clock ) .
‘How old’s Sam?’ ‘He’s seven (= seven years old ) .’

detailed_translations.english: the number 7
the number 7

sentences.english: It’s only eight days till Christmas.
They woke at eight (= eight o’clock ).
My parents died when I was eight (= eight years old ).

detailed_translations.english: the number 8

sentences.english: He’s only been in this job for nine months.
sentences.chinese: 他干这份工作才九个月。

sentences.english: We open at nine (= nine o’clock ).
Kay was taught by her mother till she was nine (= nine years old ).
sentences.chinese: 凯一直由她妈妈教到九岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 9

sentences.english: Snow had been falling steadily for ten days.
I need to be home by ten (= ten o’clock ) .
At the time, she was about ten (= ten years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 10

sentences.english: Jerry, this is my friend Sue.
She’s always out with her friends.
sentences.chinese: 她常同朋友们一起出去。

sentences.english: One of her closest friends died at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 她的一位密友周末过世了。

sentences.english: I met Jim through a friend.
sentences.chinese: 经一位朋友介绍，我认识了吉姆。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you know and like very much and enjoy spending time with

sentences.english: They climbed out through the window.
Boost me up so I can look in the window.
sentences.chinese: 把我向上抬起，这样我能朝窗户里面看。

sentences.english: They deducted the cost of the broken window from his allowance.
sentences.chinese: 他们从他的津贴中扣除损坏窗户的费用。

detailed_translations.english: a space or an area of glass in the wall of a building or vehicle that lets in light

name: red
trans: adj. 红色的；红肿的，充血的

sentences.english: We painted the door bright red .
a red balloon
I like the way the artist uses red in this painting.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢画家在这幅作品中对红色的运用。

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of blood
the colour of blood

name: yellow
trans: n. 黄色；黄种人；黄色颜料

sentences.english: yellow flowers

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
to become yellow or make something become yellow

name: blue
trans: adj. 蓝色的；沮丧的，忧郁的；下流的
n. 蓝色；[复数]（美国海、陆、空三军穿的）蓝色制服；蓝颜料；[the blue(s)][用作单数或复数]布鲁斯（歌曲）（一种伤感的美国黑人民歌
vt. 把…染成蓝色；使成蓝色；给…用上蓝剂；用上蓝剂于

sentences.english: the blue waters of the lake
She nearly always dresses in blue.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎总是穿蓝色的衣服。

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day
the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day

sentences.english: beautiful green eyes
Raw coffee beans are green in colour.
a room decorated in pale blues and greens
sentences.chinese: 用浅蓝色和浅绿色装修的房间

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of grass or leaves
the colour of grass and leaves

sentences.english: orange juice
orange peel
Peel the oranges and divide them into segments.
sentences.chinese: 把橙子去皮，然后切成片。

sentences.english: orange groves (= where orange trees grow )

detailed_translations.english: a round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside

name: brown
trans: adj. 棕色的，褐色的；太阳晒黑的

sentences.english: This particular model is available in brown, white, or grey.
sentences.chinese: 这个型号的产品有棕色、白色和灰色的。

sentences.english: the browns and greens of the landscape

detailed_translations.english: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee

name: white
trans: adj. 白色的；白种的；纯洁的

sentences.english: young white males

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the race of people with pale skin

name: black
trans: adj. 黑色的；黑人的；邪恶的
vt. 使变黑；把鞋油等涂在…上；把（眼眶）打成青肿

sentences.english: a black evening dress
It was still pitch black (= very dark ) out.

detailed_translations.english: having the darkest colour, like coal or night

name: cold
trans: adj. 寒冷的；冷淡的，不热情的；失去知觉的

sentences.english: She splashed her face with cold water.
a blast of cold air
We slept on the cold ground.
The house felt cold and empty.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里感觉很冷，空荡荡的。

sentences.english: Martin was really cold towards me at the party.
sentences.chinese: 马丁在聚会上对我非常冷淡。

sentences.english: I was shivering with cold.

detailed_translations.english: something that is cold has a low temperature
a low temperature or cold weather

name: hot
trans: adj. 热的；辣的；热情的；激动的；紧迫的

sentences.english: a hot day in July
a hot curry

detailed_translations.english: something that is hot has a high temperature - used about weather, places, food, drink, or objects

name: tired
trans: v. 疲倦；对…腻烦（tire的过去分词形式）
adj. 疲倦的；厌倦的，厌烦的

sentences.english: He looks tired out (= very tired ) .
‘No,’ Frank said in a tired voice.

detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to sleep or rest

detailed_translations.chinese: 疲倦；对…腻烦（tire的过去分词形式）

name: happy
trans: adj. 幸福的；高兴的；巧妙的

sentences.english: It’s a lovely house and we’ve been very happy here.
sentences.chinese: 房子很漂亮，我们住在这里非常开心。

sentences.english: I’ve never felt happier in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生从未感到如此快乐。

sentences.english: He was a happy child who rarely cried.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个快乐的孩子，很少哭鼻子。

sentences.english: the happy faces of the children
This has been the happiest day of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这是我一生中最快乐的一天。

detailed_translations.english: having feelings of pleasure, for example because something good has happened to you or you are very satisfied with your life

name: sad
trans: adj. 难过的；悲哀的，令人悲痛的；凄惨的，阴郁的（形容颜色）

sentences.english: The relationship had been important to me and its loss left me feeling sad and empty.
sentences.chinese: 这种关系对我一直都很重要，失去它让我感到难过而空虚。

sentences.english: I'm sad that Julie's marriage is on the verge of splitting up.
sentences.chinese: 我为朱莉的婚姻处于破裂的边缘感到难过。

detailed_translations.english: If you are sad, you feel unhappy, usually because something has happened that you do not like

name: body
trans: n. 身体；主体；大量；团体；主要部分

sentences.english: the human body
My fingers were numb and my whole body ached.
He needs to overcome a negative body image (=  what you think about your own body  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他需要克服对自己身体的负面印象。

sentences.english: A dog found the body of a girl in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 一条狗在树林里发现了一具女孩的尸体。

sentences.english: the main body of the text

detailed_translations.english: the physical structure of a person or animal

name: hand
trans: n. 手，手艺；帮助；指针；插手
vt. 传递，交给；支持；搀扶

sentences.english: Steve gripped the steering wheel tightly with both hands.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫双手紧握方向盘。

sentences.english: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.
sentences.chinese: 她手中拿着的是一张破旧的老照片。

sentences.english: the hour hand

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold things

name: head
trans: n. 头；头痛；上端；最前的部分；理解力
adj. 头的；主要的；在顶端的
vt. 前进；用头顶；作为…的首领；站在…的前头；给…加标题
vi. 出发；成头状物；船驶往

sentences.english: He kissed the top of her head.
Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.english: They dived head first into the water.
She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.chinese: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.english: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.english: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.chinese: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

detailed_translations.english: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc

name: arm
trans: n. 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .
They walked along the beach arm in arm (=  with their arms bent around each other’s  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
detailed_translations.english: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

sentences.english: a young boy with skinny legs
She fell and broke her leg.

detailed_translations.english: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

sentences.english: My foot hurts.
I had blisters on the soles of my feet .
I dropped a glass earlier, so don’t walk around in bare feet .
sentences.chinese: 我刚才打破了一个玻璃杯，所以不要光着脚到处走。

sentences.english: The vet examined the horse’s hind feet .
He walked to the foot of the stairs.
He’s six feet tall , with blonde hair.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，一头金发。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that you stand on and walk on

name: left
trans: adj. 左边的；左派的；剩下的
n. 左边；左派；激进分子

sentences.english: She held out her left hand.
a scar on the left side of his face

detailed_translations.english: your left side is the side of your body that contains your heart

name: right
trans: adj. 正确的；直接的；右方的
adv. 正确地；恰当地；彻底地

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
Is that the right time ?
I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

name: hair
trans: adj. 毛发的；护理毛发的；用毛发制成的
vi. 生长毛发；形成毛状纤维

sentences.english: Her hair was short and dark.
a short fat man with no hair on his head
The cat has left white hairs all over the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 白色的猫毛掉得满沙发都是。

detailed_translations.english: the mass of things like fine threads that grows on your head

name: eye
trans: n. 眼睛；视力；眼光；见解，观点

sentences.english: He’s got beautiful eyes.
There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
sentences.chinese: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。

sentences.english: A surgeon needs a good eye and a steady hand.
sentences.chinese: 做外科医生眼要准，手要稳。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

name: mouth
trans: vt. 做作地说，装腔作势地说；喃喃地说出

sentences.english: He lifted his glass to his mouth.
Liam was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
sentences.chinese: 利亚姆大张着嘴，睡得很熟。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

sentences.english: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
sentences.chinese: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

detailed_translations.english: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with

name: nose
trans: n. 鼻子；嗅觉；突出的部分；探问
vi. 小心探索着前进；探问

sentences.english: Someone punched him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 有人一拳打在他的鼻子上。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

name: face
trans: n. 脸；表面；面子；面容；外观；威信
vt. 面对；面向；承认；抹盖

sentences.english: She had a beautiful face.
Her face was white with fear.
A big smile spread across his face.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸上绽开了灿烂笑容。

sentences.english: I felt like punching him in the face.
sentences.chinese: 我真想给他脸上来一拳。

sentences.english: The birds build their nests in the rock face.

detailed_translations.english: the front part of your head, where your eyes, nose, and mouth are

name: warm
trans: vt. 使…兴奋；使…温暖；使…感兴趣

sentences.english: The house was lovely and warm.
I hope we get some warm weather soon.
sentences.chinese: 我希望天气很快就会回暖。

sentences.english: I’ve put your dinner in the oven to keep it warm.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的饭菜放进了烤箱里保温。

sentences.english: warm water

detailed_translations.english: slightly hot, especially in a pleasant way
to make someone or something warm or warmer, or to become warm or warmer

name: cool
trans: adj. 凉爽的；冷静的；出色的
vt. 使…冷却；使…平静下来

sentences.english: She swam out into the cool water.
sentences.chinese: 她往外游向清凉的水里。

sentences.english: The evening air was cool.
Relax in the sun with a cool drink.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光下喝杯清凉饮料放松一下。

sentences.english: the cooler weather of September

detailed_translations.english: low in temperature, but not cold, often in a way that feels pleasant
to make something slightly colder, or to become slightly colder
a temperature that is pleasantly cold
used to tell someone to stop being angry, violent etc

name: doctor
trans: vt. 修理；篡改，伪造；为…治病；授以博士学位

sentences.english: She was treated by her local doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她由她的本区医生治疗。

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment to see Dr Pugh.
a Doctor of Law

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained to treat people who are ill

name: Dr.
trans: abbr. （书写形式）医生；（用于街道名）路

name: family
trans: n. 家庭；亲属；家族；子女；[生]科；语族；[化]族
adj. 家庭的；家族的；适合于全家的

sentences.english: Do you know the family next door?
The Webb family still has its farm over there.
sentences.chinese: 韦伯家依然保留着那里的农场。

sentences.english: The family now live in London.
This house isn’t big enough for a family of seven.
sentences.chinese: 这房子住不下七口之家。

sentences.english: My family come from Scotland originally.

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who are related to each other, especially a mother, a father, and their children

name: father
trans: n. 父亲，爸爸；神父；祖先；前辈
vt. 发明，创立；当…的父亲

sentences.english: Ask your father to help you.
Andrew was very excited about becoming a father.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁初为人父，非常激动。

sentences.english: I have sinned, Father.
Freud is the father of psychoanalysis.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德是精神分析之父。

detailed_translations.english: a male parent

name: mother
trans: n. 母亲；大娘；女修道院院长
vt. 生下；养育；像母亲般关怀或照管

sentences.english: His mother and father are both doctors.
the relationship between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的关系

sentences.english: Goodnight, Mother.
Mother said they’d met at university.
sentences.chinese: 母亲说他们是在大学里认识的。

sentences.english: If food is scarce, the mother will feed the smaller, weaker chicks.
sentences.chinese: 如果食物稀少，母禽就喂较小、较弱的幼禽。

detailed_translations.english: a female parent of a child or animal

sentences.english: I have two brothers, William and Mark.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个兄弟，威廉和马克。

sentences.english: My big brother (=  older brother  ) has always looked after me.
my twin brother
We must work together, brothers!
sentences.chinese: 我们必须携手工作，伙计们！

detailed_translations.english: a male who has the same parents as you

name: sister
trans: n. 姐妹；（称志同道合者）姐妹；修女；护士
adj. 姐妹般的；同类型的

sentences.english: Janet and Abby are sisters.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮特和阿比是两姐妹。

sentences.english: He has two sisters and a brother.
sentences.chinese: 他有两个姊妹和一个弟弟。

sentences.english: She’s my twin sister .
...the International Monetary Fund and its sister organization, the World Bank.
sentences.chinese: …国际货币基金组织和它的姐妹机构，世界银行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 姐妹；（称志同道合者）姐妹；修女；护士
detailed_translations.english: a girl or woman who has the same parents as you
You can use sister to describe something that is of the same type or is connected in some way to another thing you have mentioned. For example, if a company has a sister company, they are connected.

name: China
trans: adj. 中国的；中国制造的

detailed_translations.english: the People's Republic of China

name: short
trans: adj. 短的；不足的；矮的，低的

sentences.english: a short meeting
Morris gave a short laugh.
a short course on business English
Winter is coming and the days are getting shorter.
I’ve only been in Brisbane a short time .
For a short while (= a short time ) , the city functioned as the region’s capital.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市曾经在很短的一段时间里是这个地区的首府。

sentences.english: I learned a lot during my short period as a junior reporter.
sentences.chinese: 在当初级记者的这段短暂时间里，我学到了许多。

sentences.english: Germany achieved spectacular economic success in a relatively short period of time .
sentences.chinese: 德国在相对较短的时间里取得了非凡的经济成就。

sentences.english: They met and married within a short space of time .
sentences.chinese: 他们从相识到结婚时间很短。

sentences.english: I promise to keep the meeting short and sweet (= short in a way that is good, especially not talking for a long time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我保证会议开得简短不拖拉。

sentences.english: For a few short weeks (= they seemed to pass very quickly ) the sun shone and the fields turned gold.
sentences.chinese: 短短的几个星期里，阳光照耀，田野变成了一片金黄。

detailed_translations.english: happening or continuing for only a little time or for less time than usual
a short film shown in the cinema
to almost do something but then decide not to do it

name: tall
trans: adj. 高的；长的；过分的；夸大的

sentences.english: He was young and tall.
a house surrounded by tall trees
This bush grows tall very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 这种灌木很快就能长高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 高的；长的；过分的；夸大的
detailed_translations.english: a person, building, tree etc that is tall is a greater height than normal

detailed_translations.chinese: (Tall)人名；(马里、阿拉伯)塔勒；(芬、罗、瑞典)塔尔；(英)托尔；(土)塔勒

name: policeman
trans: n. 警察，警员；[分化] 淀帚（橡皮头玻璃搅棒）

sentences.english: He tried to corrupt the policeman with money.
sentences.chinese: 他设法用金钱向警察行贿。

sentences.english: The thief withered under the stare of the policeman.
sentences.chinese: 小偷在警察的逼视下显得惶恐不安。

sentences.english: I think he must be a policeman, he keeps fishing for information.
sentences.chinese: 我想他肯定是警察，他不断地转弯抹角地打听消息。

detailed_translations.english: A policeman is a man who is a member of the police force

sentences.english: I took a bus to San Francisco.
sentences.chinese: 我乘公共汽车去旧金山。

sentences.english: Buses run at 15 and 30 minutes past the hour.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车在每小时的15分和30分时发车。

detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that people pay to travel on

name: driver
trans: n. 驾驶员；驱动程序；起子；传动器

sentences.english: a taxi driver
Do you think you’re a good driver?
sentences.chinese: 你认为自己是个好司机吗？

detailed_translations.english: someone who drives a car, bus etc

sentences.english: the workers’ revolution

detailed_translations.english: the members of the  working class

name: old
trans: adj. 陈旧的，古老的；年老的

sentences.english: an old man
How old are you?
Are you older than Sally?
You’re old enough to get your own breakfast now.
sentences.chinese: 你现在已经长大，可以自己弄早餐了。

sentences.english: I’m not coming skating. I’m too old for that now.
sentences.chinese: 我不去玩溜冰，我现在太老玩不动了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is old has lived for a very long time

name: young
trans: n. 年轻人；（动物的）崽，仔
adj. 年轻的；初期的；没有经验的

sentences.english: a young child
He’s younger than me.
You’re too young to get married.
young trees
When I was young, I wanted to be a model.
John was a great footballer in his younger days(= when he was younger ).
sentences.chinese: 约翰年轻时是个很棒的足球运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 年轻的；初期的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: a young person, plant, or animal has not lived for very long
young people

name: birthday
trans: n. 生日，诞辰；诞生的日子

sentences.english: It’s my birthday on Monday.
My aunt called to wish me a happy birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈打电话来祝我生日快乐。

sentences.english: The City of Cleveland Orchestra is celebrating its 200th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 克利夫兰市管弦乐队正在庆祝乐队成立200周年。

detailed_translations.english: the day in each year which is the same date as the one on which you were born

name: party
trans: n. 政党，党派；聚会，派对；当事人 [复数 parties]
vi. 参加社交聚会 [ 过去式 partied 过去分词 partied 现在分词 partying ]

sentences.english: We’re having a small party this evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚有个小聚会，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

sentences.english: the party spirit
I have always voted for the Labour Party.

detailed_translations.english: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc

name: cake
trans: n. 蛋糕；块状物；利益总额

sentences.english: We had cake and ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃了蛋糕和冰激凌。

sentences.english: a chocolate cake

detailed_translations.english: a soft sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, butter, sugar, and eggs
